update.description:
Use `GAZEBO_CFLAGS` (pkg-config) or `GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS` (cmake find_package) in example plugin compilation CMakeLists.txt files (fixes a bunch of test failures).

This requires [sdformat pull request 172](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/172/add-std-c-11-flag-to-sdf_configcmakein-and/diff)

content.raw: We should technically be using `GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS`, but `pkg_check_modules` only sets `GAZEBO_CFLAGS`, and yes they are set differently.
content.html: We should technically be using GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS, but pkg_check_modules only sets GAZEBO_CFLAGS, and yes they are set differently.

content.raw: This one does `pkg_check_modules(gazebo)` on line 5, and then `find_package(GAZEBO)` at line 7. It seems weird, but I didn't feel like judging, so I just made it work. Feel free to object.
content.html: This one does pkg_check_modules(gazebo) on line 5, and then find_package(GAZEBO) at line 7. It seems weird, but I didn't feel like judging, so I just made it work. Feel free to object.

content.raw:
You don't need it if you use `find_package(gazebo)`; it's only for the `pkg_check_modules(gazebo)` calls. I would be happy to use something different, but I couldn't figure out how.

I personally prefer `find_package`, but maybe it's nice to have examples that use both, so people know how to use either one?
content.html:
You don't need it if you use find_package(gazebo); it's only for the pkg_check_modules(gazebo) calls. I would be happy to use something different, but I couldn't figure out how.

I personally prefer find_package, but maybe it's nice to have examples that use both, so people know how to use either one?

content.raw:
seems to work fine running the EXAMPLE tests. 

On a side note, I was running this on OS X  and cmake complains about `MACOSX_RPATH` is not specified. This is not related to this PR but just bringing it up in case if it's something we want to fix later.
content.html:
seems to work fine running the EXAMPLE tests.

On a side note, I was running this on OS X and cmake complains about MACOSX_RPATH is not specified. This is not related to this PR but just bringing it up in case if it's something we want to fix later.

content.raw: Wouldn't it be cool if we could define a more readable macro for `${GAZEBO_CFLAGS}` so that `string (REPLACE ";" " " GAZEBO_CFLAGS "${GAZEBO_CFLAGS}")` didn't have to go in every file?
content.html: Wouldn't it be cool if we could define a more readable macro for ${GAZEBO_CFLAGS} so that string (REPLACE ";" " " GAZEBO_CFLAGS "${GAZEBO_CFLAGS}") didn't have to go in every file?
